intro: Pultenaea cymbifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions such as New South Wales and Queensland. Its narrow, linear leaves and yellow flowers make it a notable species in its native habitat. The plant is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
